issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The assignee is validating and attempting to reproduce this issue.
status.name: Investigating

fields.description:
During my latest round of Windows guest testing I noticed that guests were losing network connectivity to their public IPs. It appears that their gateways were not up to date. The CC is changing the IP assigned to the bridge for the guest(s)/security group used as the gateway. Opening this bug to track why this might be happening. 
Some additional info, looked at this with [~chuck] who noticed that during period(s) where the remote CC (in the separate cluster) went down, the cc index position can potentially change. This change may drive the remove/add GW ip operation.  
Thanks,
-M

{code}
fields.summary: Guest losing gw as CC swaps out IP on bridged interface

comments.body: Need to investigate if this is still an issue in 4.2 or if the refactoring and implementation changes in eucanetd have resolved the issue.
